Post","shareImage":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/15br-comp-3rdpartyevergreens-v2-orange-social-1920x1080-f4d4bdd0836b.jpg","sticky":false,"title":"REBOOT A FRIEND: PLAY TOGETHER, EARN TOGETHER!","content":"<p>Reboot a Friend is back! With the recent launch of Chapter 2 Season 6, now’s a great chance to invite your friends back to the fun and show them what’s new.<br />\n<br />\nBetween April 6, 2021 and April 26, 2021, earn free rewards by inviting and playing Fortnite with friends that haven’t played in 30 or more days.<br />\n<br />\nHow can you participate in Reboot a Friend? Follow these easy steps: <br />\n<br />\n<strong>Steps</strong></p>\n\n<ol>\n\t<li>Head over to the <a href=\"https://rebootafriend.fortnite.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Reboot a Friend website</a>.</li>\n\t<li>Choose up to three eligible friends you’d like to reboot.</li>\n\t<li>Play games with those friends to earn points and receive prizes.</li>\n</ol>\n\n<p><br />\nDrop-in and join the fun to earn never-before-released items -- for FREE! <strong>Note:</strong> these items may be made available to players elsewhere at another date. <br />\n<br />\nWe want you to show us your good times: share screenshots of you and your Rebooted friends playing Fortnite together by using the #RebootAFriend hashtag on Twitter! <br />\n<br />\nCheck out the Reboot a Friend video, FAQ, and rules below. </p>\n\n<div class=\"embed-responsive embed-responsive-16by9\"><iframe allowfullscreen=\"true\" class=\"embed-responsive-item\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KtXJid0k-xg\" width=\"100%\"></iframe></div>\n\n<p> </p>\n\n<h1>REBOOT A FRIEND FAQ</h1>\n\n<h3><br />\nWHO IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE REBOOT A FRIEND PROGRAM?</h3>\n\n<p>Anyone can log into the <a href=\"http://rebootafriend.fortnite.com\">Reboot a Friend website</a> and check and see if they have friends eligible to be rebooted. <br />\n<br />\nCheck out the full rules at the official Reboot a Friend rules page.</p>\n\n<h3>HOW LONG DOES REBOOT A FRIEND LAST?</h3>\n\n<p>Reboot a Friend is available from April 6, 2021, at 3 AM ET through April 26, 2021, at 2:59 AM ET.</p>\n\n<h3>WHAT REWARDS CAN I EARN?</h3>\n\n<p>There are four total rewards you can earn from Reboot a Friend. Those include the Reboot Spray, Heartbeat Wrap, Toxic Flash Glider, and the Plasma Carrot Pickaxe (2 variants)</p>\n\n<h3>ARE THESE REWARDS EXCLUSIVE?</h3>\n\n<p>These are not exclusive items. The rewards that are a part of Reboot a Friend between April 6 and April 27 have never been released before. However, at some point, they may be available for purchase.</p>\n\n<h3>HOW DO I GET REWARDS?</h3>\n\n<p>Both invitees and those inviting friends can unlock rewards by playing games together. Rewards will be granted to your account within seven days of unlocking them through progress. Playing a game with a rebooted player earns you and that player 100 points. Every game after that is worth 10 points.  </p>\n\n<p style=\"text-align:center\"><img alt=\"Fortnite Reboot A Friend Rewards Eng\" src=\"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/fortnite-reboot-a-friend-rewards---eng-1920x1080-f7d0fef71739.jpg\" style=\"height:auto; width:auto\" /></p>\n\n<h3>WHICH OF MY FRIENDS ARE ELIGIBLE TO BE REBOOTED?</h3>\n\n<p>To reboot someone in Reboot a Friend, you’ll need to have friends on your Friend List who meet the program requirements. Most notably, only friends who haven’t played Fortnite for 30 days or more can be rebooted.</p>\n\n<h3>WHAT DO I DO IF I DON’T HAVE ANY FRIENDS WHO HAVEN’T PLAYED IN 30 OR MORE DAYS?</h3>\n\n<p>No problem! If you have no rebootable friends, you can still earn points by selecting any friend on your friend list as a squadmate. You’ll be able to earn 10 points per game with these friends. Note: you won’t be able to score the 100-point first-game bonus.</p>\n\n<h3>WHAT HAPPENS IF MY FRIENDS LIST CHANGES?</h3>\n\n<p>Your list of eligible friends is locked when you first log into the campaign website. Afterward, adding or deleting friends won’t change your eligibility.</p>\n\n<h3>HOW MANY FRIENDS CAN I REBOOT?</h3>\n\n<p>You can reboot up to three friends at a time.</p>\n\n<h3>WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY REBOOT A FRIEND REWARDS?</h3>\n\n<p>The prizes will be issued to all winners within seven days of unlocking them.</p>\n","featured":false,"date":"2021-04-06T14:54:00.000Z","link":"aff20f46-5cdd-4fb4-b488-ae06fdbdf32b","_id":"aff20f46-5cdd-4fb4-b488-ae06fdbdf32b","pageMapping":"aff20f46-5cdd-4fb4-b488-ae06fdbdf32b","slug":"reboot-a-friend-play-together-earn-together","urlPattern":"/blog/reboot-a-friend-play-together-earn-together","locale":"en-US","noIndex":false,"_script":"undefined","category":[],"tags":[],"_metaTags":"<meta name=\"description\" content=\"Reboot a Friend returns for Fortnite Chapter 2 Season 6. Tilted Zone Wars, Clix Box Fights, Pro 100, RED VS BLUE RUMBLE, Prison Breakout and more are at the top\">\n<meta name=\"twitter:description\" content=\"Check out the best Fortnite Creative Map Codes for the week of Mar 30 2021. Tilted Zone Wars, Clix Box Fights, Pro 100, RED VS BLUE RUMBLE, Prison Breakout and more are at the top\">\n<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/s15-evergreen-green-social-1920x1080-73bcf56f719e.jpg\">\n<meta name=\"twitter:image\" content=\"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/s15-evergreen-green-social-1920x1080-73bcf56f719e.jpg\">\n<meta name=\"twitter:card\" content=\"summary_large_image\">","catLocaleMap":{},"nextSlug":"reboot-a-friend-play-together-earn-together","prevSlug":"stream-your-fortnite-gameplay-to-friends-inside-houseparty"},{"trending":false,"noTopImage":false,"gridTitle":"Stream Fortnite to Friends inside Houseparty","image":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/hp-fortnite-sidekick-blog-576x576-thumbnail-576x576-9cd0b19636c4.png","contentTypeSticky":false,"author":"The Fortnite Team","enableLightbox":false,"_type":"Common Post","shareImage":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/hp-fortnite-sidekick-blog-1920x1080-share-1920x1080-74edfe329dbc.png","title":"Stream Your Fortnite Gameplay to Friends inside Houseparty","content":"<p>Beginning in November 2020, players on PC and PlayStation have been able to <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/news/houseparty-brings-video-chat-to-fortnite\">video chat with their friends in Fortnite via Houseparty</a>. Now, players can also stream their Fortnite gameplay to Houseparty. Learn how to both stream your gameplay to friends as well as watch your friends’ streams! </p>\n\n<div class=\"embed-responsive embed-responsive-16by9\"><iframe allowfullscreen=\"true\" class=\"embed-responsive-item\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/D3I85RKBlHI?rel=0\" width=\"100%\"></iframe></div>\n\n<h2><br />\nHow to Stream and Watch Your Friends’ Streams in Houseparty</h2>\n\n<p>When you activate Fortnite Mode in Houseparty, all of your Houseparty friends will be able to see a livestream of your Fortnite gameplay. Houseparty will notify your friends when your game feed is available, and you’ll receive notifications when your friends are streaming. Jump into a stream, leave some words of encouragement, and help them along the way!<br />\n<br />\n<img alt=\"Stream Fortnite Gameplay To Houseparty\" src=\"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/stream-fortnite-gameplay-to-houseparty-1920x1080-c2c8fd412140.png\" style=\"height:auto; width:auto\" /></p>\n\n<h2><br />\nHow to Link Up Fortnite and Houseparty</h2>\n\n<p>Both video chat in Fortnite via Houseparty and streaming the game to the app are currently available to players on PC, PlayStation 5, and PlayStation 4. To install Houseparty, players will need an iOS or Android mobile device. With the app installed, connect your Houseparty account to your Epic Games account to start video chatting or streaming. </p>\n\n<h2><br />\nA Refresher on Video Chat in Fortnite</h2>\n\n<p>To bring video chat into Fortnite:</p>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>Open Houseparty on iOS or Android and connect to Fortnite through Settings or the TV icon.</li>\n\t<li>Join your friends like you normally would or invite them to join you.</li>\n\t<li>Fire up Fortnite on a PC or PlayStation.</li>\n\t<li>Continue talking to your friends while you play. (Make sure your mobile device is positioned to fully frame your face.)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>When using video chat, your Houseparty friends in your Fortnite party will be displayed live on a side panel, leaving the game screen unobstructed. It’s the perfect way to bring the fun of in-person gaming to playing together remotely!<br />\n<br />\nTo learn about the safety features of Houseparty video chat in Fortnite, including parental controls, head over to our <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/news/houseparty-brings-video-chat-to-fortnite\">video chat announcement post</a> or our <a href=\"https://houseparty.com/blog/houseparty-video-chat-on-fortnite-safety-tips/\">Fortnite/Houseparty Player Safety post</a>.<br />\n </p>\n\n<hr />\n<p><br />\nSquad up with your friends face-to-face — or share the fun with them on-stream! Have more questions about streaming your gameplay? Take a look at our FAQ below:</p>\n\n<h2><br />\nStreaming Fortnite to Houseparty - FAQ</h2>\n\n<h3><br />\nWill streaming Fortnite to Houseparty (as well as video chatting in Fortnite via Houseparty) be integrated on other gaming platforms?</h3>\n\n<p>At the moment, Fortnite gameplay integration with Houseparty is only available for PC and PlayStation (PS4 and PS5). We will let everyone know if we’re able to support more platforms in the future.</p>\n\n<h3><br />\n<br />\nHow do I know how many / if Houseparty users are watching my stream? </h3>\n\n<p>The “watcher count” in Fortnite, represented by a little eye in the middle-left of the screen, will show the number of watchers from Houseparty. In Houseparty, users viewing a stream will have an eye icon in the top-left of their video cell.</p>\n\n<h3><br />\n<br />\nHow can players turn off Fortnite Mode streaming in Houseparty? Do they have to turn off Fortnite Mode altogether?</h3>\n\n<p>Players who have enabled Fortnite Mode streaming can turn off the feature in their privacy settings. In the Privacy Settings menu, players can turn off streaming and stop sharing their gameplay with their Houseparty friends. Players will still be able to use Fortnite Mode and cast Houseparty to Fortnite when this setting is off to video chat with their friends — they just won’t be able to see your gameplay.</p>\n\n<h3><br />\n<br />\nHow can players know that their private information isn’t being streamed to a Houseparty room? </h3>\n\n<p>Payment information will be blocked from being streamed to Houseparty. The Lobby, your menus, and gameplay will all be streamed in Fortnite Mode if you interact with those screens while Fortnite Mode streaming is turned on.<br />\n<br />\nAs with all streaming platforms, it is important to limit what players share on screen. While Fortnite Mode streaming is limited to a much smaller group of connections (players and up to 9 other people) rather than the public internet, all players should be cautious about directly or indirectly sharing personally identifiable or sensitive information — just like with any social network.</p>\n","trendingImage":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/hp-fortnite-sidekick-blog-1900x600-header-1900x600-d300e685f047.png","sticky":false,"featured":false,"date":"2021-04-05T16:30:00.000Z","link":"b6652a91-406f-4764-b00a-e34fc33b4ffc","_id":"b6652a91-406f-4764-b00a-e34fc33b4ffc","pageMapping":"b6652a91-406f-4764-b00a-e34fc33b4ffc","slug":"stream-your-fortnite-gameplay-to-friends-inside-houseparty","urlPattern":"/blog/stream-your-fortnite-gameplay-to-friends-inside-houseparty","locale":"en-US","noIndex":false,"_script":"undefined","category":[],"tags":[],"_metaTags":"<meta And with the included Battle Pass, you’ll be able to unlock even more V-Bucks!</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Core Text Content","header":"1,000 Bonus V-Bucks Every Month","theme":{"_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Text Content Theme"},"placement":"center"},"_noIndex":false,"_images_":["https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/vbucks-left-796x722-503453116.png","https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/vbucks-center-665x372-567612938.png","https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/vbucks-right-796x722-503453124.png"],"numColumns":"3","_urlPattern":"/subscription/subscription-vbucks","_slug":"subscription-vbucks","_activeDate":"2020-11-05T00:56:56.732Z","lastModified":"2020-11-24T14:36:02.535Z","_locale":"en-US","_id":"4457c6f1-0a5e-4917-8522-9a8105e1e605","_templateName":"SubscriptionCoreSection"},{"componentDetails":{"_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Component Details","name":"subscription-bundle"},"imageDetails":{"imageMobile":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/anonymouscharacterbundle-m-682x427-567662206.png","imageRight":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/anonymouscharacterbundle-940x963-511731041.png","imagePosition":"center","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Core Image","imageSize":"contain"},"_title":"subscription-bundle","textContent":{"textSection":"<p>The Crew Pack is an exclusive Outfit Bundle that’s yours to keep, and special items are curated for the Pack monthly. Each month’s Crew Pack features an exclusive new Outfit plus at least one matching accessory like a Glider, Pickaxe, or Emote.<br />\n<br />\nApril's Pack features Alli, the once estranged sister of Lynx. In addition to her Outfit, the April Crew Pack includes the Squee Back Bling, Skellyfish Pickaxe, Cat’s Paw Wrap, and Catwalk Loading Screen.<br />\n<br />\n </p>\n\n<div class=\"embed-responsive embed-responsive-16by9\"><iframe allowfullscreen=\"true\" class=\"embed-responsive-item\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KuVhoMXTONI?rel=0\" width=\"100%\"></iframe></div>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Core Text Content","header":"A New Monthly Crew Pack","theme":{"textAlign":"left","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Text Content Theme","primaryColor":"black","styleOverrides":"{\"width\": \"50%;\", \"margin\": \"0 auto;\", \"padding\": \"0px;\", \"margin-top\": \"2em;\", \"align-self\": \"center;\"}","secondaryColor":"black"},"placement":"left"},"_noIndex":false,"_images_":["https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/anonymouscharacterbundle-940x963-511731041.png","https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/anonymouscharacterbundle-m-682x427-567662206.png"],"numColumns":"2","_urlPattern":"/subscription/subscription-bundle","_slug":"subscription-bundle","_activeDate":"2020-11-05T00:57:53.713Z","lastModified":"2021-03-31T23:14:33.168Z","_locale":"en-US","_id":"ab39130e-5d28-4664-8ef7-84701cbda881","_templateName":"SubscriptionCoreSection"},{"componentDetails":{"_type":"Fortnite - Subscription Component Details","name":"subscription-faq"},"_title":"subscription-faq","header":"Fortnite Crew FAQs","faqList":{"_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ List","items":[{"question":"How can I purchase the Fortnite Crew subscription?","answer":"<p>The Fortnite Crew subscription can be purchased directly from the Item Shop or Battle Pass purchase screen.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"What’s in a Crew Pack?","answer":"<p>Monthly Crew Packs always contain a new Outfit along with at least one accessory. All items are exclusive to Fortnite Crew members.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"Can I still purchase a Battle Bundle?","answer":"<p>The Battle Bundle has been replaced by a bundle of 25 levels, available for 1,850 V-Bucks. The offer is available to players at level 75 or lower at any time, once per season. This bundle can be packaged together when buying the standard Battle Pass by itself, or purchased after buying the standalone Battle Pass or acquiring it as a member of Fortnite Crew.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"Once I’m subscribed, how do I get my items each month?","answer":"<p>Your Subscription is associated with the platform on which you purchased it (your “Primary Platform”) until it is cancelled and is not transferable. Be sure to choose the platform (e.g., Xbox, PlayStation, Switch) you purchase your Subscription on carefully. You’ll be able to access the items you receive from the Subscription across different platforms, but the V-Bucks you receive may not be redeemable on other platforms. You must log into your Primary Platform each monthly subscription period to access your Subscription Content.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"When is my next V-Bucks or Crew Pack grant?","answer":"<p>Please refer to the Fortnite Crew in-game tab to see your next V-Bucks or Crew Pack grant which is delivered monthly.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"Are my V-Bucks bound to the platform I purchase them on?","answer":"<p>V-Bucks purchased on PlayStation or Nintendo Switch cannot be spent on other platforms. Any Fortnite content you buy with your V-Bucks will be available on every device linked to your Fortnite account, regardless of which device the content was bought on.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"How can I cancel my Fortnite Crew subscription?","answer":"<p>You can also cancel your Fortnite Crew subscription at any time. Go directly in-game and check out the Fortnite Crew tab to guide you based on your active game device.</p>\n\n<p>Even after cancelling, your membership will remain effective until the end of your current billing period. You will keep all previously awarded Battle Passes, V-Bucks, and Crew Packs.<br />\n<br />\n<em>Subscribed to Fortnite Crew through your Xbox account and would like to cancel? Learn more about <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/help/en-US/fortnite-c75/trending-topics-c140/how-can-i-cancel-my-fortnite-crew-subscription-a7522\" target=\"_blank\">Xbox cancellation steps</a>.</em><br />\n </p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"What happens if I already purchased the current season’s Battle Pass or Items in the Crew Pack prior to subscribing to Fortnite Crew?","answer":"<p>\n<style type=\"text/css\"><!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}-->\n</style>\nIf you already purchased the current season’s Battle Pass, a one-time 950 V-Bucks return will be applied to your account.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"What does it mean that Crew Packs are exclusive?","answer":"<p>\n<style type=\"text/css\"><!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}-->\n</style>\nCrew Packs and the items they contain are only available to Fortnite Crew subscribers. Previously released items may be made available again to Crew members at a later date. They will never be sold to non-Crew members or given away to non-Crew members.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"Why can’t I see Fortnite Crew in the game?","answer":"<p>If you're unable to see the Fortnite Crew option in-game starting December 2nd, your platform, country (or combination of both) or available payment methods may not be supported at this time. We'll keep working on adding more options as time goes on.</p>\n","_type":"Fortnite - Subscription FAQ Item"},{"question":"How do I update my billing information for my subscription?","answer":"<p>Refer to the billing instructions from your platform of choice. Open Graph data for Facebook -->\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"Article\">\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"Learn How to Set Fortnite Parental Controls\">\n<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"Setting Fortnite parental controls is easier than ever with our parental controls Guide.\">\n<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/image.jpg\">\n<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/parental-controls\">\n\n<!-- Twitter Card data -->\n<meta name=\"twitter:card\" content=\"summary\">\n<meta name=\"twitter:title\" content=\" Learn How to Set Fortnite Parental Controls\">\n<meta name=\"twitter:description\" content=\"Setting Fortnite Parental Controls is easier than ever with our parental controls guide.\">\n<meta name=\"twitter:image\" content=\"https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/image.jpg\">","_title":"Fortnite Parental Controls","Title":"Fortnite Parental Controls","metaImage":"https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/13br-parentalcontrols-newsheader-small-1920x600-467347481.jpg","_noIndex":false,"metaDescription":"Learn how to configure Fortnite parental controls. Our settings guide walks you through protecting your family member’s Fortnite experience easily.","_images_":["https://cdn2.unrealengine.com/13br-parentalcontrols-newsheader-small-1920x600-467347481.jpg"],"content":"<h1>Fortnite Parental Controls</h1>\n\n<h4><br />\n<strong><span style=\"font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif\"><a href=\"Parental-Controls-Within-Fortnite\">PARENTAL CONTROLS WITHIN FORTNITE</a><br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"#Parental-Controls-via-Gaming-Platform\">PARENTAL CONTROLS VIA GAMING PLATFORM</a> (INCLUDES PURCHASE CONTROLS)<br />\n<br />\n<a href=\"#Epic-Games-Store-Parental-Controls-for-Fortnite\">EPIC GAMES STORE PARENTAL CONTROLS FOR FORTNITE</a> (INCLUDES PURCHASE CONTROLS)</span></strong></h4>\n\n<p><br />\nFortnite offers a range of parental controls to help you manage what a player can see and do in Fortnite. In addition to the controls within Fortnite, you can make adjustments through the Epic Games Store as well as your preferred gaming platform, including PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, and mobile devices. The parental controls through the Epic Games Store and your preferred gaming platform include the option to restrict purchases.</p>\n \n\n<h2 id=\"Parental-Controls-Within-Fortnite\">Parental Controls Within Fortnite</h2>\n\n<p><br />\n1. Launch Fortnite on your platform of choice.<br />\n<br />\n2. Once in the Lobby, open the menu in the upper-right of the screen.<br />\n<br />\n3. Select “Parental Controls.\"<br />\n<br />\n4. You will be asked to confirm the email address linked to the account. If no email address is linked to the account, you'll be guided to a web browser so that you may link one.</p>\n\n<p><br />\n5. Set a unique six-digit PIN. This PIN will be required to change parental controls in the future, so make sure to set a PIN that is different from other PINs that you use and is easy for you to remember.</p>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>If you forgot your PIN or just want to change it, you can follow the steps in our <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/help/epic-accounts-c74/parental-controls-c111/how-do-i-reset-my-pin-for-parental-controls-on-my-epic-games-account-a3264\">support article on how to reset your PIN for parental controls</a>.</p>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><br />\n6. Set the parental controls that you wish to have enabled or disabled.</p>\n\n<h3><br />\nSettings Overview</h3>\n\n<p> </p>\n\n<div><strong>Can See Mature Language - ON or OFF</strong><br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> Mature language can appear in text chat.</div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> Mature language in text chat will be filtered and replaced with heart symbols.</div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div><br />\n<br />\n<strong>Can Accept Friend Requests - ON or OFF</strong><br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> Player receives all friend requests as normal.</div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> Player cannot receive friend requests. Incoming friend requests will be automatically denied. </div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div><br />\n<br />\n<strong>Non-Squad Members Can See Your Name - ON or OFF</strong><br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> Players who are not in your squad will be able to see your display name. </div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> Replace your display name to players who are not in your squad with \"Anonymous.\" </div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div><br />\n<br />\n<strong>Can See Non-Squad Member Names - ON or OFF</strong><br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> You will see the display names of players who are not squad members.</div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> Replace the display names of players who are not in your squad with \"Player.\"</div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div><br />\n<br />\n<strong>Voice Chat - ON or OFF</strong><br />\n<br />\n<strong>NOTE:</strong> This setting only enables/disables Fortnite’s in-game voice chat. The platform you are playing on may have additional communication features that must be restricted separately. Information on platform-specific controls can be <a href=\"#Parental-Controls-via-Gaming-Platform\" target=\"_self\">found below</a> or by clicking the “More Settings” button in-game.<br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> You can hear your teammates and talk to them using a microphone.</div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> You cannot hear or talk to teammates.</div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div> \n<div><br />\n<strong>Houseparty Video Chat in Fortnite - ON or OFF</strong></div>\n\n<div> </div>\n\n<div><em>Fortnite players who use the video chat app Houseparty can link their Houseparty and Epic accounts and have their Houseparty video chat shown alongside their Fortnite game. Houseparty video chat is currently available to Fortnite players on PC, PlayStation 5, and PlayStation 4.</em></div>\n\n<div> </div>\n\n<div><strong>NOTE:</strong> Because Houseparty is a separate application, this Fortnite parental controls setting does not control any features within the Houseparty app and does not prevent a Houseparty user from joining a room which is being shown in another player’s Fortnite game.</div>\n\n<div> </div>\n\n<div><strong>NOTE:</strong> This setting cannot be enabled if Voice Chat is disabled through parental controls.<br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li><strong>ON:</strong> If they have linked their Houseparty and Epic account, a player can set their Houseparty video chat to show up on the same screen they are playing Fortnite on. While in use, Houseparty friends and friends-of-friends can be seen and heard while playing Fortnite.</li>\n\t<li><strong>OFF:</strong> The player is not able to set their Houseparty video chat to show up on the screen they are playing Fortnite on (this will not affect the player’s ability to use Houseparty outside of Fortnite).</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div><br />\n<br />\n<strong>Weekly Playtime Reports - ON or OFF</strong></div>\n<br />\n<strong>NOTE:</strong> Click on the \"More Settings\" button in-game to learn about playtime restrictions for your platform.</div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> A weekly playtime report will be sent to the email address associated with the account.</div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> No playtime reports will be sent.</div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<div><br />\n<br />\n<strong>Text Chat - ON or OFF</strong><br />\n<br />\n<strong>NOTE:</strong> This setting only enables/disables Fortnite’s in-game text chat. The platform you are playing on may have additional communication features that must be restricted separately. Information on platform-specific controls can be <a href=\"#Parental-Controls-via-Gaming-Platform\" target=\"_self\">found below</a> or by clicking the “More Settings” button in-game.<br />\n </div>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>ON:</strong> You can send and receive text chat messages with your teammates.</div>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<div><strong>OFF:</strong> You cannot send or receive text chat messages with your teammates.</div>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><br />\nUse the SAVE button to save your selections. If you wish to change any of these settings in the future or disable parental controls, you will need to enter your PIN. The email associated with the account will be notified whenever a PIN is changed.</p>\n \n\n<h2 id=\"Parental-Controls-via-Gaming-Platform\">PARENTAL CONTROLS VIA GAMING PLATFORM</h2>\n\n<p><br />\nThe parental controls within Fortnite only apply to the features in Fortnite, regardless of the platform that it’s being played on. This means that if you, for example, turn off voice chat in Fortnite, you may still be able to access voice chat for the game using communication methods outside of it, such as by using the party system built into your console.<br />\n<br />\nIf you would like to more broadly restrict access to such features, you can do so at the platform level on PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, Windows 10, iOS, and Google Play. <strong>This includes restricting access to purchases</strong>.<br />\n<br />\nPlatforms offer a range of parental controls, including restrictions on:</p>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Purchasing</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Communication with other players</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Playtime</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Adding friends</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Access to multiplayer</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Broadcasting gameplay</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Which games can be played and downloaded</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>What content can be seen and shared</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>The details that can be seen about other players</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Access to web browsing</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>The use of VR</p>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><br />\nLinks to information on each platform’s specific parental controls and how to set them up are provided below.</p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>PlayStation</strong></p>\n\n<p>Sony's PlayStation controls include controls over spending limits, social features, and access to games, content, and the internet.<br />\n<br />\nLearn more about <a href=\"https://www.playstation.com/support/account/ps5-parental-controls-spending-limits/\" target=\"_blank\">PlayStation 5 parental controls</a> or <a href=\"https://support.playstation.com/s/article/PS4-Parental-Controls\" target=\"_blank\">PlayStation 4 parental controls</a>.</p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>Xbox</strong></p>\n\n<p>Microsoft's Xbox controls include restrictions on purchasing, broadcasting gameplay, and access to social features including communication and multiplayer modes. <br />\n<br />\nLearn more about <a href=\"https://support.xbox.com/help/family-online-safety/browse\" target=\"_blank\">Xbox parental controls</a>.</p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>Nintendo Switch</strong></p>\n\n<p>Nintendo offers controls over features including purchasing, playtime management, content viewing and sharing, and communication on Nintendo Switch. <br />\n<br />\nLearn more about <a href=\"https://www.nintendo.com/switch/family-fun/parental-controls/\" target=\"_blank\">Nintendo Switch parental controls</a>. </p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>Windows 10</strong></p>\n\n<p>With the controls Windows 10 provides, you can set restrictions on activities including purchasing, playtime, access to content, broadcasting, and more.<br />\n<br />\nLearn more about <a href=\"https://account.microsoft.com/family/\" target=\"_blank\">Windows 10 parental controls</a>.</p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>iOS</strong></p>\n\n<p>Apple iOS allows you to block or limit specific apps and restrict the settings on an iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch, including for purchases and downloads, access to explicit content, and privacy. Please note that iOS purchasing restrictions do not apply to in-game Fortnite purchases made through Epic direct payment. To restrict purchases made through Epic direct payment, use the Epic Games Store parental controls <a href=\"#Epic-Games-Store-Parental-Controls-for-Fortnite\" target=\"_self\">detailed below</a>. <br />\n<br />\nLearn more about <a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/ht201304\" target=\"_blank\">iOS parental controls</a>. </p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>Google Play</strong></p>\n\n<p>Google Play offers controls for restricting mature content, accidental purchases (via password protection), the ability to share apps in a Family Library, and more. Please note that Google Play purchasing restrictions do not apply to in-game Fortnite purchases made through Epic direct payment. To restrict purchases made through Epic direct payment, use the Epic Games Store parental controls <a href=\"#Epic-Games-Store-Parental-Controls-for-Fortnite\" target=\"_self\">detailed below</a>. <br />\n<br />\nLearn more about <a href=\"https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/6209547?hl=en\" target=\"_blank\">Google Play parental controls</a>.</p>\n\n<p><br />\n<strong>What about the Epic Games App on Android?</strong></p>\n\n<p>For Fortnite on the Epic Games App on Android, you can use the in-game Fortnite parental controls to restrict or allow specific types of behavior. In-game purchasing restrictions for Fortnite on the Epic Games App are managed by Epic Games Store parental controls, <a href=\"#Epic-Games-Store-Parental-Controls-for-Fortnite\" target=\"_self\">detailed below</a>.</p>\n \n\n<h2 id=\"Epic-Games-Store-Parental-Controls-for-Fortnite\">Epic Games Store Parental Controls for Fortnite </h2>\n\n<p><br />\nOn the Epic Games website, you have access to parental controls for the Epic Games Store. These controls offer you the ability to use a PIN to restrict Epic Games Store purchases (as well as to restrict access to content on the Store based on age ratings). Epic Games Store purchases include in-game Fortnite purchases made through the Epic Games Store (purchases on PC, Mac, the Epic Games App on Android, and iOS and Google Play through Epic direct payment).<br />\n<br />\n<strong>NOTE:</strong> Purchases made through the Epic Games Store do NOT include in-game Fortnite purchases made through PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo, the Apple App Store, or the Google Play Store. For info on parental controls for these, please refer to the “Parental Controls via Gaming Platform” section <a href=\"#Parental-Controls-via-Gaming-Platform\" target=\"_self\">above</a>.</p>\n\n<h3><br />\n<br />\nHow to Adjust Parental Controls for the Epic Games Store</h3>\n\n<p><br />\nThere are two paths to open the Epic Games account settings to adjust parental controls:<br />\n<br />\n<strong>Directly from epicgames.com</strong></p>\n\n<ol>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Go to <a href=\"http://epicgames.com\" target=\"_blank\">epicgames.com</a>.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Log in at the top right.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Hover over your account name.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Select “Account” to go to your account settings.<br />\n\t </p>\n\t</li>\n</ol>\n\n<p><strong>From the Epic Games Store Launcher on PC/Mac</strong></p>\n\n<ol>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Open the Epic Games Launcher and log in.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Click on your account name in the bottom-left corner.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Select the Manage Account option. This will open a web browser with your account settings.</p>\n\t</li>\n</ol>\n\n<p><br />\nNow that you’re in the account settings, scroll down to the Parental Controls section in the General Settings page.<br />\n<br />\nFrom here, you can set or enter your six-digit PIN.</p>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>This PIN will be required to change parental controls in the future, so make sure to set a PIN that is different from other PINs that you use and is easy for you to remember. If you already have a PIN for Fortnite, your PIN # will carry over.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>If you forgot your PIN or just want to change it, you can follow the steps in our <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/help/epic-accounts-c74/parental-controls-c111/how-do-i-reset-my-pin-for-parental-controls-on-my-epic-games-account-a3264\" target=\"_blank\">support article on how to reset your PIN for parental controls</a>. </p>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><br />\nEpic Games Store parental controls include:<br />\n </p>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Changing your PIN.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Requiring a PIN for Epic Games Store purchases.</p>\n\t</li>\n\t<li>\n\t<p>Limiting access to games based on their ESRB, PEGI, or GRAG age rating. </p>\n\t</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><br />\nWhen you’re done setting your options for parental controls, save them before closing the options window. To turn parental controls off, select “Turn Parental Controls Off” in the Parental Controls section of the General Settings page and input your PIN.</p>\n","_urlPattern":"/parental-controls","_slug":"parental-controls","_activeDate":"2019-05-28T21:36:31.526Z","lastModified":"2021-01-13T15:47:58.976Z","_locale":"en-US","_id":"76f5f708-9519-4d40-9110-f71b02c3b60d","_templateName":"blankPageHeaderImage"}}};
